intro: Tabebuia buchii, commonly known as the pink trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The tree has a distinctive, flaky bark and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Tabebuia buchii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
